section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter applies to the affidavit that, under Election Law Article, §14-104(c)(3), Annotated Code of Maryland, a person doing public business may file in lieu of a statement of contributions.

para.text: The name of the person doing public business;
The name of the governmental entity that the person does public business with;
A statement, under penalty of perjury, that the person doing public business has not:
Made applicable contributions in the cumulative amount of $500 or more to a candidate or for the benefit of a nonfederal candidate during a reporting period; and
Completed the performance of work on the contract with the governmental entity; and
An acknowledgment that the person doing public business is required to either file the next scheduled statement of contributions or file a new affidavit in lieu of that statement.

section.heading: Filing.
section.text: The person doing public business shall:

para.text: Complete the affidavit using the Internet form provided by the State Board; and
Sign and submit the affidavit using the electronic signature password issued by the State Board.

annotations.annotation: Election Law Article, §§2-102(b)(4), 14-104, and 14-109, Annotated Code of Maryland
